If folks have a moment, Iâ€™d love some thoughts on this Ghave deck Iâ€™m building. Iâ€™m trying to keep the overall CMC low, but I think Iâ€™ve underpowered in that pursuit. 

<http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/ghaved-1/>
Hardened scales, dictate of erebos, gravepact

I switched out hardened scales for the constrictor since itâ€™s easier to bring back a body vs. an enchantment. The others I knew I left out to reduce the CMC because over 50% of my deck was at 4 CMCâ€¦I was trying to see if I could go a different route.
I'd still consider Hardened Scales. While it may be harder to bring back, it should stick around easier/longer by not being on a body.
I suspect what I have is neither fish nor fowl at the moment.
I like the curve haha this is what I want all my decks to look like
But I agree dictate or grave Pact (at least one) should be in there
I like Blood artist/zulaport in ghave too
You probably want another board wipe in there if you don't want to run pact or dictate or butcher of malikir
Yeahâ€¦Iâ€™m trying to explore other builds than the defaults/naturals.
Another thought is if you run a curve like that, aether vial becomes way better
Wellâ€¦except for the $40+ price tag...
:wink:
I'd add sword to plowshares and remove panharmonicon. You don't have a lot of eta effects
I gotcha, what's the ideal way you win with this deck?
ETB*
Oh lordâ€¦I removed them in the pursuit of the curveâ€¦nevermind folksâ€¦nothing to see here.
This is a bad, bad buildâ€¦stop looking. Look away!
Another thought: armor craft judge for card draw, rishkar's expertise is just up the alley if most green decks too
Yeahâ€¦had all those inâ€¦back to square one.
I mean, the deck is focused on the counters and less recursion, so you are on the right track there, expertise just seems better than harmonize, I wonder is rishkar himself would be good
In which case then greater good might not be the place to go if we aren't doing recursion, does offer value in a lot of match ups though
agreed
Abzahn ascendacey also seems like it could fit in, but probably not good enough for the deck itself
So, I also wonder if mana reflections is good enough for such a low cmc deck
It's a great card but we aren't cast huge spells or trying to dump our hand over and over
Managorger hydra is a house on a deck like this
I think the other mikaeus might be better for that slot, as many creatures are going to have +1/+1 counters on them and won't benefit from the undying most of the time
Though abzan ascendancy combos pretty well with twilight drover
As far as abzan catch all spot removal spells: putrefy, and mortify should at least be considered as well,, even acidic slime would be good if you want another creature there instead
Sorry if I'm spamming you Henry, this is just how a build decks, I go through everything g then trim back a whole bunch
No worries. Thanks for the thoughts but I'm going back to a shell and starting over. This current build isn't the right foundation to build upon.
Losing focus on a deck is by far the biggest reason why I end up taking them apart and starting over
It's happening with my Roon deck, and I'm sad.
I have a Birthing Pod and have never built one of those decks do perhaps that is an avenue to explore. I do want to focus on recursion.
Pod decks are great
I was joining modern just as that was banned out, I was a sad man as I wanted to try that one
Okâ€¦I made a new version, but now I need to make 14 cuts, so Iâ€™m to that point.
<http://tappedout.net/mtg-decks/ghaved-1/>
Necroplasm kills your tokens on the first end step no?
Not to add more to a deck you're trying to cut stuff from, but---Cultivate and Kodama's Reach are conspicuously absent
Sure, but those are merely resources so I wonâ€™t care. I have other ramp spells vs. those, though I probably should add Wood Elves back in.
Given the nature of the deck
Also, if I have Dictate or Pact out, then if I wonâ€™t have creatures, neither will anyone else.
Also I can manage it to have Ghave out and put a counter on Necroplasm if I want to keep my tokens.
Just wanted to be sure you knew haha it's not a bad call
Oh sure! Fortunately I did think about it :wink:
At least I tried
This a much more focused list

-Mana Reflection
-Noxious Gearhulk
-Cataclysmic Gearhulk
-Necroplasm
-Renegade Rallier
-Primal Growth
-Skullbriar, the Walking Grave
-Restoration Specialist
-Selfless Spirit
-Noxious Revival
-Llanowar Elves
-Return to Dust and replace it with +Sylvan Reclamation
-Nissa, Voice of Zendikar
-Collective Voyage

I also personally enjoy the following, so I'll plug them again, but you made your case about them already, so it's not a big deal:
+Swords to Plowshares
+Cultivate 
+Kodama's Reach
You also seem to like Gearhulks, so +Verdurous Gearhulk

I don't think Mikaeus will be as helpful as you think, but if you do insist on running him, and running Ghave as a combo deck, no less, then +Triskelion

I also would cut Gaea's Blessing and Riftsweeper but I get the feeling you like them. I mean you probably like all these cards. These are just my personal +1/+1 counter preferences
I have never seen a cataclysmic gear hull resolve in a way that made the caster really happy
The Blessing is meta-specific - lots of mill decks.
I figured as much. A friend in my playgroup runs an old Kozilek in a deck that rarely if ever casts it, just for the reshuffle effects
I have Patrick and I was looking for good 5 and 6 drop targets for pod/evolution etc. i need some board wipes and thought I should try on a body.
Sounds good then, green warden of murasa might be up your alley as well
The Resto specialist is to get back any of my non-creature bits in.case they go to.the grave.
Not enough people run Noxious Revival...
1 Phyrexian I can put any card in any graveyard on top of a library.
I can remove Reflection - it made more sense when I had Cryptolith Rite in.
Agreed

I've tried it. I have a Mimeoplasm, Meren, Gitrog, and Titania deck. Graveyards are my jam. But I've consistently found it less useful than I'd hoped.  It's alright for politicking around, I suppose, and I do also have a K&T politics deck, but there are better cards than the revival for graveyard politics
Maybe go down the mentor of the meek and ivy lane?

<@U3MTJRAQL>: I wasn't thinking of it politically, but strategically. Very often its another way to stop several combo decks in my meta to remove a key piece when it hits the grave and prevent them from competing their loop.
Since it uses Phyrexian mama I could appear tapped out and give the impression that the 'coast is clear'.

I do feel there are more powerful versions of that effect, but to each their own. There's a subtle power to the revival that a lot of players don't embrace, I just haven't been enthused by it in the past
Which world you suggest?
Also I'm tuning for my meta.

For graveyard elimination? Rest in Peace, Relic of Progenitus, Leyline of the Void. If a deck is based upon a graveyard interaction, wipe out the graveyards altogether. I have loops in my Meren deck, for example, and frequently I have multiple cards that do the same thing, so taking out a single piece won't change much, since I can complete the loops with  another card (examples: eternal witness/greenwarden; living death/twilight's call; gray merchant of asphodel/kokusho).
After those, though, I'd suggest repeatable removal, like Withered Wretch, or Necrogenesis. Repeatable effects are powerful stuff, which is why Scavenging Ooze can be such a menace.

TL;DR in my experience one-shot effects have been less effective at screwing up my graveyard plans than broad or repeatable removal
I like angel of finality for gy hate, just because it's on a decent body
It is a one shot though
I guess it depends on how badly you want to hate on gys though
as another graveyard player I strongly agree with that tl;dr
I like the angel in a blink deck.
It's Pod-able
Sure and is...I just wish Pod was capable of instant-speed activation :disappointed_relieved:
Same... :sweat_smile:
What about Perilous Forays?
